intro: Edraianthus tarae, commonly known as the Tarae's fireweed, is a perennial plant native to the island of Sardinia. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
